title: Cloud9 taking the Hai road to Worlds
body: Cloud9 is playing for a spot in Worlds.

#CLOUD 9 USES SPIRIT BOMB ON GRAVITY
#CLOUD 9 WIN
#CLOUD 9 PROCEED TO NEXT STAGE

But will the Earth be able to give C9 enough E N E R G Y to take down the mighty MVP Rush and TIP? And how will Hai and his friends get through Team Liquid?! Find out next time, on the NA LCS Regional Qualifiers- Z.

**CLOUD 9 USES SPIRIT BOMB ON ~~GRAVITY~~ TiP
CLOUD 9 WIN
CLOUD 9 PROCEED TO NEXT STAGE**

**CLOUD 9 USES SPIRIT BOMB ON ~~GRAVITY TiP~~ LIQUID**
**CLOUD 9 WIN**
**CLOUD 9 PROCEED TO NEXT STAGE**
**CLOUD 9 ~~PROCEED TO NEXT STAGE~~ GO TO WORLDS**

Sure the odds are against them, but they're teamwork and great leadership is what have made them so dominating in earlier seasons. I've supported them from the start and will continue to do so... LETS GO CLOUD 9!
I'm pretty sure I'm the only one who doesn't believe in Cloud9. I just doubt that their crazy strategies will last 3 Bo5s.
No most people expect TL to go as the third seed, but Cloud 9 still has a large fan base so it seems like there's a lot of hype around the team

Well, on paper, I can see why you would assume TL would have the best shot. That is how TL has always been though, a roster filled with skill that should be able to beat everyone else in NA. But as they proved in the playoffs, they have no idea how to play the game once the clock hits 20 minutes. Even worse, they aren't able to get enough of an early game advantage to just flat out win. Between the total and complete collapse of GV and the suspension of TiP's star player, C9 actually has a really good shot at worlds with their ability to actually contest and trade objectives. More significantly, C9 has a chance to actually do something at worlds, while TL will get absolutely destroyed by every other team that has qualified as of now.

They have a good shot at GOING to worlds. They do not have a shot at actually doing something at worlds. Especially since 3rd seed is likely to land them in the group of hell. Unless CLG plays like they did against TSM (actually better since there were some pretty close moments) at worlds NA is likely to have a rough showing. Let's not forget C9, when they were allegedly on a surge to return to their former selves, dropped a game to TDK running an all AD composition.

On the whole C9 thing, if you "could" make the argument, then actually make it. Assuming all semifinalists were stronger, which isn't unreasonable, meaning that SSW, SSB, SHRC and OMG were stronger than C9. I also would say that EDG were stronger, going 3/2 in the quarters against finalists SHRC. TSM won the NA LCS split against C9, so arguably TSM was stronger than C9, however that's stretching somewhat, I'm not gonna watch the VODS just for the argument. Alliance, Whiteshield were both roughly equal to C9, from just their group performance, however if you take their results from the summer season, NJWS was stronger than C9, as was Alliance. NJWS having taken down summer regional champions, KT Arrows in the regional qualifier, who were the strongest team in Korea (their run through the playoffs was insane). However the way Korean teams qualified for worlds, meant they couldn't get there. The upset loss to Kabum by Alliance really was just an upset. 

So: SSW, SSB, SHRC, OMG and EDG were definitely stronger, that's already 5 teams that are stronger, just at worlds, then you have KT Arrows and NJWS, who in a best of 5 most likely would have been stronger, having more experience from Champions in playing a series of games. Alliance may have been stronger, but they were probably equal.

So actually you might be right, claiming that C9 was top 5/6 at worlds is not a huge exaggeration, I personally wouldn't agree, placing both NJWS and KTA above them, but from the results, your argument does hold up (that and KTA weren't at worlds). I personally would have them tied for  8th with Alliance and Fnatic just underneath.

I know all that, hence why I saud you would expect Tl to win it after having finished 3rd in the playoffs which included beating TiP and them having the most favourable seed. I believe anybody who actually follows the NA scene will know of TL weak points and their lack of ability to make use of their early advantages.

"I'm pretty sure I'm the only one who doesn't believe in Cloud9. I just doubt that their crazy strategies will last 3 Bo5s. " - TurquoiseYoshi

Crazy strategies are awesome for Bo5s, assuming you have enough of them. But if it's just one crazy strat done five times, you're done for. They're also less useful if they're not solid enough to force a ban from the other team.

As for C9 chances specifically, I'm not really sure. Hai clearly wasn't that prepared for returning to the LCS initially. If he's got himself back into shape and re-integrated with the team, they may again be a serious force to reckon with.

Of course there's also the question of Gravity getting back into their mid-season shape, which was just beautiful. I honestly don't understand what happened to them. They were doing everything right and just started to do everything wrong.

It's going to be a wild Gauntlet.

I know that crazy strats can win Bo5s very easily, I just don't think C9 has enough of them. 6-10 games is a whole lot, and after those, they're easy to pick/ban away. If it gets used once and wins, then the losing team bans it. Then they pull out something more meta and probably get beaten. I don't think C9 can make enough of these weird jungle picks to win 9 games.

Ya, you're right. I misread your comment. I missed the "3" before "Bo5s." My bad there.

That said, C9 may not need crazy strats to win all their games. C9 were definitely good enough last split to beat most teams without such craziness. A lot will depend on whether or not Gravity shows up.

Also, I didn't think about this until now, but TIP is probably going to be brutal. Rush is going to just abuse Hai in the jungle. I'm really curious if C9's trying to figure out a solution to that. Or if Hai's just hoping he'll be able to handle it.
#C9 GAUNTLET HYPE
